As to the number of which this committee shall consist,
that cannot be determined till we know the manner in which
it is to be appointed.
The third resolution is, "that said committee shall be apportioned among the several parishes represented in this Convention on the basis adopted for voting."
As to this mode of apportionment, I have selected it as the
fairest and most impartial. There is but one other basis that
occurs to me, viz : the proportion in which each parish subscribes for stock. That last basis of apportioning the committee, is liable to two objections: 1st, That the precise
amount of such subscription cannot now be exactly ascertained.
2nd, That such a mode might exclude talent and science and
experience, that may be very useful to the discharge of its
duties by the committer:. Gold, and silver, and iron, and
